Description: Volute handle and rim sherd (consisting of 3 fragments, two joining) of Laconian black-glazed pottery volute-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: white slip on exterior surface of rim and on sides of volute handle; glazed black on top of rim and handle; on rim chevrons; on sides of volute curvind diagonal strokes; neck glazed black.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.40.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 562, no. E46)
Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 93, no, B23, pl. 4, no. 2.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.35) (phase 3)
